sources.title: Daniel Boone (1936) | Colorized Public Domain Adventure Classic with George O‚ÄôBrien & Heather Angel
sources.description:
Daniel Boone (1936) is an American historical adventure film directed by David Howard and starring George O‚ÄôBrien, Heather Angel, and John Carradine. This colorized and restored version of the public domain classic brings new vibrancy to a story about courage, leadership, and the struggle to settle Kentucky during the turbulent frontier years. With careful digital restoration and colorization, this timeless tale is reintroduced to modern audiences in the United States, Europe, and beyond, ensuring its legacy continues for generations.

Plot Summary:
Set in the late 18th century, the film dramatizes the legendary frontier exploits of Daniel Boone (George O‚ÄôBrien), who leads settlers through the wilderness to establish a colony in Kentucky. Boone faces challenges not only from hostile Native American tribes defending their land but also from the treachery of Simon Girty (John Carradine), a turncoat who allies with the British. Alongside Boone is Hope Halley (Heather Angel), a young settler whose courage and spirit embody the resilience of the pioneers.

As Boone leads the settlers through danger, ambushes, and betrayal, he demonstrates the qualities that would make him a symbol of American frontier bravery: resourcefulness, determination, and a deep belief in the promise of new land. The film culminates in a thrilling showdown that tests Boone‚Äôs leadership and the settlers‚Äô will to survive.

Cast and Crew:
‚Ä¢ Director: David Howard
‚Ä¢ Screenplay: Philip Dunne (adaptation and dialogue)
‚Ä¢ Story: Based on the legendary exploits of Daniel Boone
‚Ä¢ Cinematography: Frank B. Good
‚Ä¢ Editing: George Hively
Starring:
‚Ä¢ George O‚ÄôBrien as Daniel Boone
‚Ä¢ Heather Angel as Hope Halley
‚Ä¢ John Carradine as Simon Girty
‚Ä¢ George Regas as Black Eagle
‚Ä¢ Huntley Gordon as Capt. Paulsing
‚Ä¢ Clarence Muse as Pompey
‚Ä¢ Harry Cording as Painter

Film Significance:
‚ÄúDaniel Boone‚Äù (1936) reflects the 1930s fascination with American frontier mythology and the romanticized vision of westward expansion. Produced during the Great Depression, the film gave audiences both escapism and patriotic reassurance by celebrating resilience, pioneering spirit, and community. George O‚ÄôBrien, best known for his silent film career and later Westerns, brings heroic stature to the role. John Carradine delivers a memorable performance as Simon Girty, making him one of early Hollywood‚Äôs defining villains.

Enhanced Public Domain Explanation:
This film is in the public domain, which means it is completely free of copyright restrictions and can be legally shared, viewed, studied, and preserved without limitation. Colorized Public Domain restores and enhances these historic works through careful digital cleaning, visual restoration, and colorization techniques. Our mission is to ensure that timeless classics like Daniel Boone remain available to a worldwide audience. By presenting them in color and modern quality, we make them more engaging and accessible to younger generations who might otherwise overlook black-and-white cinema. This process respects the original film while providing a new layer of appreciation for today‚Äôs viewers.

Why Watch This Colorized Edition:
The original 1936 release was black and white, consistent with the technology and budget of its time. While authentic to its era, modern audiences often bypass black-and-white films. By offering a colorized edition, we enhance accessibility and appeal while preserving the historical essence. This edition provides a bridge between cultural preservation and contemporary entertainment, making the story of Daniel Boone and the American frontier relevant to today‚Äôs global audience.

Subscribe and Explore More Classics:

We upload restored and colorized films from the Golden Age of cinema, from forgotten B-movies to culturally significant classics. Our work ensures these treasures remain discoverable, enjoyable, and preserved for audiences in the USA, Europe, and worldwide.

sources.title: Daniel Boone, Trail Blazer REMASTERED Full Adventure Movie Bruce Bennett Lon Chaney Jr.
sources.description: Daniel Boone leads settlers into Kentucky but must battle Shawnee warriors who have been persuaded by a French renegade that Boone and the settlers are there to kill them and steal their land.

metadata.Plot: In 1775, Daniel Boone leads thirty settler families to Kentucky where they face two threats: Indian raiders led by renegade white Simon Girty, who opposes settlement; and the schemes of effete Stephen Marlowe to seize title to the new lands. Perils, battles, escapes, and a love interest round out the story.
